newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice surges ahead of USDA supply/demand data.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice surges ahead of USDA supply/demand data.

text.p: CBOT rice futures ended sharply higher on a late rally tied to ideas Monday's USDA supply and demand data would spark gains, pit sources said.
"We did 90 percent of the volume on the day in the last minutes of trade," one floor trader said. "We've got a report on Monday and all I'll say is rice is simmering."
LFG was said to be an aggressive buyer late and LIT was a buyer of September.
Costa Rican buyers were still negotiating for 26,500 tonnes of rice and results were expected early next week, U.S. exporters said.
Rice ended 13-1/2 to two cents per cwt with July up 13-1/2 at $11.31-1/2. Volume was estimated by CBOT at 250 lots, compared with Thursday's actual volume of 286 lots.
